Policy_Narrative: Ariyalur is classified as Tier 3 (Monitor (3-5 year horizon)). The predicted groundwater depth is 4.05m in 2026 and 3.98m by 2028. The water table is currently recovering at 0.23 metres per year. The district is 92% groundwater-dependent for irrigation. Primary SHAP analysis indicates: cumulative seasonal depletion memory is moderating depletion; long-term structural decline trend is moderating depletion; seasonal groundwater volatility is driving depletion upward. Recommended transition to Bajra could reduce water consumption by 84% per kilogram of output.
